results.brief_description: Angry eraserman meets the christoberfest fairy in this family game where problem-solving skills is combined with colouring book fun.

group.title: Top Screen 2007 VCE Media Interactive Works

results.title: Charlie Chalkman's chalk catcher challenge
results.brief_description: This interactive game is designed for younger children. Set on a chalkboard, the main character Charlie (controlled by the player) tries to catch the falling chalks and fruits to achieve a high score. The player must also avoid the falling erasers, which if touched, rub Charlie out to end the game.

results.title: Nuclear map of Australia (Update 2)
results.brief_description: This interactive informational project researched, designed and coded by Glenn Todd, was inspired and modeled on the poster created by Scott Ludlam and released by ANAWA. It provides a definitive breakdown of the nuclear industry in Australia through text and photographs sourced from www.anawa.org.au, www.sea-us.org.au and the anti-nuclear community.

results.title: Video and Animation Workshops 2006
results.brief_description: A selection of video and animated works created by young students from different schools in various ACMI Workshops during 2006, including “Scratch it”, “Digital Poetry”, and “Claymation”. Also includes two untitled abstract animated works.
results.description: A selection of video and animated works created by young students from different schools in various ACMI Workshops during 2006, including “Scratch it”, “Digital Poetry”, and “Claymation”. Also includes two untitled abstract animated works.

results.title: Super Penguin
results.brief_description: A short film made in a one-day ACMI Claymation workshop where students are taught the basics of stop motion animation using modelling clay, a digital video camera and editing software. They also create an original soundtrack for their film
